Stem: In a grassland ecosystem of Wyoming, plants use sunlight to make their own food through photosynthesis. A grasshopper feeds on these plants, then is eaten by a meadow vole. Which statement correctly explains what happens to the matter from the plants throughout this sequence?
Choices: A) The matter from the plants becomes part of the grasshopper's body, then part of the vole's body, then part of the hawk's body, and finally returns to the soil through decomposition., B) The matter is converted to energy and disappears completely when the grasshopper is eaten by the vole., C) The matter is used up during the hawk's life cycle, so no plant matter remains when decomposers break down the hawk., D) The matter stays permanently in the hawk's body and cannot be broken down by decomposers. Stem: In a forest ecosystem, a caterpillar feeds on oak leaves, storing nutrients from the leaves in its body. Later, a robin eats the caterpillar.
